lazysample
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Lazy sampling

Generate permutation subsets

Generate R replicates with permutations of the rows or groups of a data frame.

permute(expr, R = 1L, n = NULL, extractor = NULL)

permute_n(n, R = 1L)

Arguments

expr

An expression for the data to be sampled. This does not need to be a data frame, as lazy_sample objects support or can be extended to support many classes. The unevaluated expression and its environment are captured as a quosure.
R

The number of permutations to generate.
n

A non-negative scalar integer representing the number of elements to sample from. If n is NULL, then expr is evaluated and called be idx_len to calculate this number. However, if n is non-NULL, then expr is not evaluated at all until samples are requested.
extractor

A function or object coercible to a function by as_function. See LazySample for more information.
...

Arguments passed to methods

Value

data frame (tibble) with R rows and the following columns.

sample

A list column with objects representing the training sets. For permute, the elements are vectors of the indexes; for permute_n, the elements are lazy_sample objects.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
